comment: Doleys is the MAN. Made class engaging even though the subject is pretty boring. Weekly quizzes aren't easy but can be done with reading weekly passage part. Very cool guy i'd reccomend taking him
highly recommend good guy easy class very fun to listen to

Honestly wasn't that hard like some other reviews were saying. There is a lot of reading, like one chapter a week, but he makes the class PowerPoints based off that and posts them after class. There was a ten question quiz every week on the reading and only two actual assignments. I think he made class interesting with kahoots so not bad
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Weekly 10-question quiz based on textbook, a midterm and a final, The midterm and quizzes are online open book/note. There are two assignments a paper and a voice-over presentation. His lectures are very detailed but you cant hear them any other place than class because the powerpoints only contain basic information and you cannot record his voice.

This professor pulls a LOT from the readings, however I never do them and as long as the powerpoints are clear, which they always are, there is PLENTY of study material for exams. He was pretty easily convinced when we asked for a study guide, and his exams are pretty much photo-copies of the exam. Just study and you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Doleys is a great guy and knows his stuff, but get ready for a reading load unlike any other. He gives random 10 question quizzes over some of the readings, so check d2l constantly! Lots of essays, but he's a fair grader and gives good feedback. if you don't completely read everything, you will fail the online tests, so READ!

McKelvy's Global Security is an Easy A compared to this class. ALOT of work and you still won't get an A. It's a graduate level class, but he is very clear in his instructions. You need the textbooks, read, read, read, read, study, study, study, write write, write. Weekly quizzes, 2 Part essay, 2 part Midterm, 2 part final.

This guys online course is not organized and he is very unclear about what he expects from students. If you ask a question he follows up with an unclear answer usually in a degrading manner towards the student who ask the question ( not only me, but other students on the open discussion board) DO NOT TAKE THIS INSTRUCTOR.

Professor Doleys was amazing. I took his class online and I loved him! He made the class interesting, even online, and he was very organized with all the assignments and such. You can tell he loves what he does and he is very good at it. Take him!

Great Prof.  Very educated, very intelligent.  Makes class interesting and always very helpful.  You can't expect to slack off outside of class though- learned that the hard way. Take the class and be prepared to study.  Enjoyed this class a lot!

VERY difficult class. A TON of work.I failed the first time and the second time barely escaped with a B. He is friendly and knows his stuff but the class is SO time consuming. Midterm, final, weekly quizzes, weekly papers, and more nightly readings than all my other classes combined. He grades very harshly and will NOT bump you up to next grade!

Very smart and interesting, but does not thoroughly prepare you for the tests. Complicated material and he does his best to explain it all, but presentation style is lacking. Understandable though. He has high expectations.
Good professor?if you like pedantic teachers whose lectures and readings are excessively boring, abstract, and convoluted.
worst teacher ever,he does not know anything about Europe and tries to teach European Union...Do not take class with this freak show

Took him for IPE and Politics of EU and will take him as much as I can.  Great professor. Knows his stuff inside and out. Hard? Not really. It's not hard work, just a LOT of it.If you want any kind of career in IA, then take him and get used to it coz all the good professors here are tough. Welcome to college boys and girls.

I am leaving Doleys' class feeling accomplished. It is one thing to complain about the heavy reading/writing load, and it is quite another to recognize the knowledge and analytical skills you gain from them. Very organized, prompt, & available for help. Don't expect to glide through; take advantage of his ability to make complex subjects relatable

Took online so naturally A LOT of reading. The prof was excellent at being involved with students and conscientious of their needs. As long as you read and participate in the discussions, you will do fine. Tests are MC and FITB. He also posts current events to review. Just pay attention and take good notes for reference.
I made the mistake of not heeding to the warnings. Being an advisor does not equal good instructor. A very inconsistent teaching of courses from this man and department.

VERY hard stuff. I personally did not consider this a lower division course. A LOT to read, not only from the text but articles and handouts. He is a very nice guy and will work with you. Just beware of all the hard work you will need to put in!
He is a good teacher. I had no interest whatsoever in IA but he changed my mind. You have to work very hard even for a B but you will learn a great deal. Loved the class.

I was in his online class. A LOT of reading. The constant discussions that are due can be a pain. Expect to study. He's a really knowledgeable guy. Overall a great prof! Def not the easiest class ever, but it's more the amount of material than conceptually difficult.

He is a nice guy, however the class is ridiculous. WAY too much for a lower level class. Papers assigned at the last minute. TONS of articles that your tested on but do not discuss in class. Expects pre-reqs that are not required. It says introduction but its not. DO NOT TAKE THIS if you do not have prior knowledge. Not helpful.

amazing class.will revolunize the way you see the world.DO NOT I REPEAT DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS IF YOU ARE NOT INTERNATIONAL AFFAIRS OR POLY SCI.it's a hard class that you have to work at and if you are not interested in the class-you will hate your life.workload is pretty heavy...but yeah this is college get used to it.
Fantastic class. There's a lot of reading, but who chooses their classes for a minimal workload, anyway?

He's an amazing prof, probably one of the best I will ever have. His classes however require a lot of preparation. If you don't study for the tests then just drop the class. He loves the subjects he teaches which is always a plus and is incredibly organized & always willing to help. I recommend him just be prepared to study/work like never before.

Difficult Professor.  Be prepared, this is probably the most difficult class you will take as an undergrad.  I've heard from several people that this was the only class that burst their 4.0.  Aside from the INTENSE load of outside reading and questions, I learn an immense amount.  He is super smart and very well educated.

Nice guy. His class has a good amount of reading and his tests are difficult but the more classes you attend and if you read everything, it should be do-able. If interested in the subject. its an interesting class,

Professor Doleys is very involved in European Union ans UN affairs, and this shows in this class: he only talks about organization, NOT LAW. BEWARE! Also, he goes on tangents and expects you to read about 100 pages per class. Gives pop quizes and has majoritarily short-answer and essay tests. Don't take him if you don't like the subject!

He's a great guy, really smart. But only take a class with him if it's your only class and you don't have a job. The class is way too much, as though he's forgotten that we have other classes. He's not a fan of A's so don't expect to get an A just because that's what you've always gotten in your classes.

Took him for 2250 and again for 4430 and wish that I hadn't. He's a great guy & loves the subject but the class is too much. Maybe if it's the ONLY class youre taking you'll be fine. Way too much reading and the tests are unclear. In lectures he tends to talk (a lot) without really saying much at all.

Was online class this summer and was extremely difficult, he expects you to literally cram the text book. The exams are not about issues but specific details, specific qoutes by specific people in the text

I took Prof. Doleys online and it was SO hard. It's an introductory class but it sure doesn't seem like it. Tests are ridiculous. If you like to study and like politics in general, I recommend him b/c he's very nice, but if POLS is not your thing, take it on campus.

I had him for POLS 2250 (intro to international relations) and POLS 4430 (international Law and Organization) He is a very clear speaker who knows what he is talking about.  He keeps his bias too an extreme minimum (purposely) which is good.  He is tough, and you need to show up to every class in my opinion.  The tests are very detailed.

He's an awesome teacher that really knows the subject. However, the class is very hard. You can do all the readings & the QTGYR & still have not make perfect grades. The tests are also hard & sometimes the questions on both tests & quizzes are difficult to understand. I would recommend taking him but be aware of that you will be reading everyday!!

This professor is so hard. But I have to say, I have learned the most from this guy. He is incredible. I barely got a B. His tests are hard. Usually 20 multiple choice (i.e. a, b, c, d, ab, abc, ad, or all of the above), 10 short answer and 2 hard essay questions. He is hard but I am happy to say i am taking him again. YOU WILL LEAN SO MUCH INFO!!!
VERY HARD! Took him online, did all reading, had attorney friend and Poli Sci Major help with tests and they were still VERY HARD. good luck taking him online!

Not my favorite class, matter of fact I had zero interest in taking it. Still have Zero interest in the subject, but Prof Doleys is obviously passionate and interested in the subject and that does help somewhat. Seems to be very interested in communicating with his students.
Awsome prof with great knowledge. If you do your work you CAN get an A. Participate, don't miss classes! The work load is VERY heavy
Very confusing, harsh grading.
class was very confusing. He kept changing the class as the semester went along.

GREAT PROFESSOR!!  I HATE history and politics, but he makes the class really easy.  The book has a website with practice tests and about half of the questions from there or on his exams.  I took notes and did ALL of the practice tests at least 3 times before the exams and did well.  EASY A!!

He's a good prof, but is a bit unclear during some of his lectures.  There are no surprises on his tests as long as you do your reading, and study.  Over all, he's fine... I just didn't care for the topic.

Awesome prof... very intelligent and engaging.  The class is heavy on international org/ less on the law aspect- he has an amazing ability to make potentially VERY dry material pretty interesting.  A LOT OF READING- this class is definitely not for people who want to slack!!!  It's a big time committment, but a good experience/ worthwhile.

This class was tough but it was so worth it. I learned so much!!!...but I wished he spent more time on International Law. Excellent class...must take it with Professor Doleys UNLESS Professor Moran teaches it!

He's a great teacher!!! He really knows what he's talking about!!!! He tries to make class interesting, well at least as interesting as gov't can be!!! He really loves teaching. Yes the tests are hard but he gives review sheets for each test and as long as you do them you're in good shape! I love his class and I would take him again!!!
HARD tests.  He takes polaroids of you, makes you fill out an index card of personal info, and puts you in asigned seeting.  Take only if you have no life and a LOT of time to study.

Great professor, vast knowledge of subject and eager to teach! This class is only for those who WANT to learn, not for slackers. Tons of reading, subscription to Economist, 3 exams and 1 essay. 10% participation grade. Posts PP lecture on WebCT and always available for help. Tough but possible A.
Very intersting class. The teacher was very organized, and knew the material, however the tests were HARD.
No Comments

Tremendous energy.  Knows his material and presents it well.  Book report I felt was a bit much, but my ECON background is shaky to begin with.  I strongly suggest you take at LEAST ECON 2200 (or 2100) before taking, it will help out a great deal.
He is a great teacher.  Verry energetic and clear, BUT by gives by far the hardest multiple choice test that I have ever taken in my whol life!!!
he is cool, but the hardest class i have taken in my life
Very Organized.All powerpoint.Funny.Interesting.Fun Class, he knows what he's talking about
